message.content:
cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of finding the length of a shortest preset distinguishing sequence (PDS) for a subset of states in a Mealy automaton, which is a problem in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also relates this problem to the diameter of transformation semigroups, which is a topic in algebra and combinatorics (cs.IT). The paper uses techniques from probability theory and asymptotic analysis, which are relevant to the fields of theoretical computer science (cs.FL) and optimization (cs.LO). Finally, the paper discusses applications of the results to control theory and robotics, which fall under the category of systems and control (cs.SY).
